title: Add support for mDot with STM32F411RE processor
Update us_ticker_api.c
body:
Common: us_ticker_API - check PRIMASK before re-enabling interrupts

Implemented logic to save the PRIMASK value returned by __disable_irq(), and check it before calling __enable_irq(). This will prevent interrupts from being prematurely re-enabled if they have been intentionally disabled by the user program.

title: Fixed IAR serial fgets fgetc
[NUCLEO L053]fixed open drain for DigitalInOut
body:
Added/fixed OpenDrain output type for Nucleo L053.

"OpenDrain" mode for DigitalInOut will generate pin with STM_MODE_OUTPUT_OD option.
Previously, using "OpenDrain" disabled Pullup/Pulldown only and the pin worked still as STM_MODE_OUTPUT_PP

title: add CooCox exporter for C027
[STM32xxx] CoIDE/gcc_arm exporter and startup_stm32xx update
body:
Several updates/additions of missing functions/corrections:
- CoIDE options: wrap main and linker option DiscradUnusedSection=1 was missing in some targets
- CoIDE options: corrected flash loader config for Nucleo_F030 and Nucleo_F072
- CoIDE options: corrected memory layout (not used by default but now they are the same as in linker scripts)
- some gcc linker scripts: changed the memory size from hex number e.g. 0x2000 to decimal e.g. 8K
- startup files: updateing to current versions of STM32 Cube drivers, original files without any changes:
- DISCO_F303VC
- DISCO_F334
- NUCLEO_F030
- NUCLEO_F072
- NUCLEO_F302
- NUCLEO_F334
- a missing wrap main in gcc_arm template of DISCO_F303 target

title: [RZ_A1H]Fix some bugs about I2C, SPI, Interruptin and add terminal definition of user button.
body:
Hi,

We fix some bugs as below.

I2C
I2C driver was not considered about 1Byte/2Byte transfer.
Add 1Byte/2Byte transfer processing in I2C driver. 

SPI
Initialize setting of SPI clock value is not correct.
Modify the value as below.
　uint16_t mask = 0x000c0; ->
　uint16_t mask = 0x000c;

InterruptIn
Fixed bugs of IRQ Edge Interrupt as below.
- Not call a function that was registered in rise, always call a function that was registered in the fall.
- If there are multiple interrupt sources, there is a possibility that end the wrong interrupt processing.

Terminal definition
Add definition of User button(SW0 and SW1) for users.

Regards,
Hamanaka

title: K20D50M Serial baudrate
body:
At line 127: http://developer.mbed.org/users/mbed_official/code/mbed-src/file/cc1c4962551c/targets/hal/TARGET_Freescale/TARGET_K20D50M/serial_api.c

uint32_t PCLK = (obj->uart == UART0) ? SystemCoreClock : SystemCoreClock/2;

This was probably copy pasted from the KLxx code, where it was used in the past, also now also has been replaced by a better version. Problem is UART0 runs on core clock, others at the bus clock. So this needs to correctly use the bus clock, where for the K20D50M the bus clock is standard not core clock / 2.

The correct way is here: http://developer.mbed.org/users/mbed_official/code/mbed-src/file/cc1c4962551c/targets/hal/TARGET_Freescale/TARGET_KLXX/TARGET_KL25Z/serial_api.c

title: [NUCLEO_F072RB/F091RC] Remove the call to Systick (mbed RTOS compliancy)
[RZ_A1H]Fix bugs that I2C freq become fixed 100kHz and a static value will be indefiniteness.
body:
Hi,

We fixed some bugs as below.

I2C:
When I2C read/write, I2C freq ignores the setting of user and it become fixed 100kHz.
Implement change the freq according to the setting of user.

gpio:
There was a function that has the potential to be called with indefiniteness argument.
Modify to not call the function with indefiniteness argument.

Regards,
Hamanaka

title: K22F IRQ vector locations
body: See; http://developer.mbed.org/users/mbed_official/code/mbed-src/file/cc1c4962551c/targets/cmsis/TARGET_Freescale/TARGET_K22F/cmsis_nvic.c. I think the ram address is wrong, causing it to be placed somewhere halfway in the RAM memory. Also the number of vectors is wrong: http://developer.mbed.org/users/mbed_official/code/mbed-src/file/cc1c4962551c/targets/cmsis/TARGET_Freescale/TARGET_K22F/cmsis_nvic.h, it has alot more interrupts.

title: IAR RTOS support M0, M0+ and M4
body: Added support for RTX m0,m0+ and M4. Increased the heap size (icf files) because the rtos basic example required it to work.

title: [LPC11XX_11CXX] Fix SPI slave issue
body:
- Fix a bug reported here:
  https://developer.mbed.org/questions/4872/SPISlave-Class-dosnt-work-on-LPC1114/
- Add IOCON settings to enable proper pin functions
- Remove non-busy check in slave_receive() function, since the SSP/SPI
  is always in busy state when received a valid data according to the
  device user manual
- Add bit mask in spi_slave_read() function
- Add TARGET_LPC1114 pin config in SPI_SLAVE test
- Tested with LPC11U24 SPI master and LPC1114 SPI slave

title: [RZ_A1H]Remove External Bus Controller settings
body:
Hi,

We removed External Bus Controller settings.
Because GR-PEACH does not have any device that connected external address area of RZ_A1H.
The External Bus Controller settings are needless at GR-PEACH.
Terminals settings will be input mode(It is default setting).

Regards,
Hamanaka

title: Added simple mbed SDK test linking against popular libraries
body:
# Description

This change should enable mbed SDK's default Travis script to perform linking against popular libraries / tests so we can 
## Changes
1. Added new function and linking scheme data structure.
2. make.py was modified in separate commit to master to allow linking to given library and to enumerate tests' names with comma when using -n switch.
3. Added linking options for LPC1768 and most popular libraries.
4. Script should dynamically generate below commands:

```
make.py -m LPC1768 -t GCC_ARM -n MBED_2,MBED_10,MBED_11,MBED_15,MBED_16,MBED_17
make.py -m LPC1768 -t GCC_ARM --eth -n NET_1,NET_2,NET_3,NET_4
make.py -m LPC1768 -t GCC_ARM --fat -n MBED_A12,MBED_19,PERF_1,PERF_2,PERF_3
make.py -m LPC1768 -t GCC_ARM --rtos -n RTOS_1,RTOS_2,RTOS_3
make.py -m LPC1768 -t GCC_ARM --usb -n USB_1,USB_2,USB_3
```

title: [USBDevice] Fix for https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/issues/690
body:
In the old K64F register .h file (same for K22F),
SIM_SOPT2_PLLFLLSEL_MASK was incorrectly set as a 1-bit field, like it
was in the KLXX devices, while it now is a 2-bit field. This has been
fixed in the current register maps, however the USB clock was set by
taking the entire mask, while only the first bit needs to be set.

This is now fixed by using the SHIFT definition, and should work also on
other Freescale targets (verified on K64, K22 and KL25)

Also the sooner you decide on my other pull request the sooner they can be automatically merged again ;)

title: WEAK mbed_sdk_init() is not overrided by the STRONG one.
body:
For STM32F103RB mbed, I had added  -Wl,--wrap=main in linker flag. But the STRONG mbed_sdk_init() function in mbed_overrides.c is not called.
The WEAK mbed_sdk_init() function in retarget.cpp is called.
Looks like the linker drops the STRONG mbed_sdk_init() function since the functions in mbed_overrides.c are not called by any other functions.

I tried to add a test function in mbed_overrides.c and called it in other functions. Then I found the STRONG mbed_sdk_init() function had also overrided the WEAK function.

Any one also met this problem. Could give some explain about this?

body: This is the initial version of LPC1768 DMA implementation. The work has not finished. Send for pull request to review the API declaration.

title: RTOS Idle Hook
body: Currently the RTOS idle task, _os_idle_demon()_, just spin locks since putting the chip to sleep is not desirable on certain platforms. Overriding this behavior requires editing the RTOS library sources, which leads to issues when the library is updated. I propose that an idle hook be introduced, similar to FreeRTOS.

title: Iar export for many NXP Platforms
[NUCLEOs] Improvement of gpio_irq hal
body:
Now it is possible to have multiple interrupt pins on EXTI vectors.
Example:
EXTI0 -> PA_0 or PB_0 or PC_0, ... only 1 pin must be selected
EXTI5_9 -> PA_5 and PA_6 and PB_7 and PC_8 and PC_9: up to 5 pins together
EXTI10_15: PA_10 and PB_11 and PB_12, ... : up to 6 pins together

title: Host test plugin improvements, part 2: Copy plugins
body:
# Description

This is second and last test suite modification related to reset / copy plugin architecture. Previous was done in https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/597 pull request.
## Changes
- New copy / reset scheme introduced where plugins are implementing how to reset / flash mbed enabled device.
- Moved copy, reset and serial port management to host_test.
- added sew command line switched to pass e.g. test binary image location.
- Cleaned unnecessary host_test functionality (dead code).
- Refactored network tests to align with new reset / copy scheme.
  - Function test() and run() usage in host tests is now more unified - code is a bit more readable.
- Few tests and minor defects corrected on the way (test / test suite stability).
## Testing

I checked new functionality on our CI server with many MUTs:
(Some of the results below)


title: resolve sleep() and deepsleep() to no-ops if DEVICE_SLEEP isn't set
[USBDevice] Fix K20D50M name
body:
Since it was initially K20D5M the name is still wrong in USBDevice. This
should fix it.

title: [NUCLEO_F4] Add PeripheralPins.c/h file
body: Move all pinouts into these 2 files.

title: nRF51822 - Add support for Serial 31250 baud (for legacy MIDI)
body: Added serial baud setting to support legacy MIDI interface.

title: [NUCLEO_F302R8] exporters for gcc_arm and coide
body:
Adds exporter for gcc_arm and coide for the NUCLEO_F302R8.

The coide exporter has the problem as described in #710. With #711 everything is running.

title: [NUCLEO_F302R8] exporters for gcc_arm and coide
body:
Adds exporter for gcc_arm and coide for the NUCLEO_F302R8.

The coide exporter has the problem as described in #710. With #711 everything is running.

title: [NUCLEO_L152RE] exporters for gcc_arm and coide
body:
Adds exporter for gcc_arm and coide for the NUCLEO_L152RE.

The coide exporter has the problem as described in #710. With #711 everything is running.

title: Name of exit function in exit.c
body:
Change the name of the exit function to _exit as suggested in clib documenation for all gcc_arm toolchains (GCC_ARM and CoIDE).

Please see issue #710

title: exit Function for GCC_ARM and CoIDE
body:
In the c-File common/exit.c for all compilers except gcc_cw an exit function is declard:

```
void exit(int return_code) { ... }
```

For gcc the behavior with this function name is not defined. The clib already defines an exit function. Depending on the linker version and the command line option order the first found exit function ist used or a linker error is generated. For a pure gcc build it is working but in CoIDE the commandline option order is predefined. 

With changing the function definition to:

```
#elif defined TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM
void _exit(int return_code) {
#else
void exit(int return_code) {
#endif
```

the _exit function name corresponds to the gcc and clib description, _exit() is called by the clib exit(). And the behavior in mbed will not change.

Please see #711

title: [EXPORT][GCC_ARM] additional linker option for wrap main
body: Most makefile templates didn't use the -Wl,--wrap,main so that __wrap_main was not called.

title: [Export][GCC_ARM][Makefile][tmpl] Fixed parallel build errro and others.
body:
Fixed:  
    (1) Parallel build option e.g. 'make -j4' was failure.  
Modified:  
    (1) Silence the warning about '-fno-rtti'.  
    (2) Each Makefile has about the same format.     

dinau

title: RTOS Documentation Issues
body: The documentation for the stack size macros in _RTX_Conf_CM.c_ lists the values as being in _bytes_. In reality, these values are treated as _word_ values and multiplied by 4.

title: Devdragonfly add target support
body: added build support for DRAGONFLY exe does NOT work

title: K64F - UART_NUM fix in a condition
body: Should fix issue #704

title: BUG on serial_api.c for target Freescale
body:
I'm running the mbed with last commit made by "Martin Kojtal" at 11-November-2014 06:38:07.
I couldn't find the commit hash :(

The BUG is on file "mbed\targets\hal\TARGET_Freescale\TARGET_KPSDK_MCUS\serial_api.c", line 163.

The code written is "#if (NUM_UART > 3)"
But the correct is "#if (UART_NUM > 3)"

Because of that, rx and tx interrupts on UART3 and UART4 are not working.
Please fix it!!

title: [RZ_A1H]Fixed a bug of serial interrupt
body:
Hello

I fixed a bug of serial interrupt as below.
Serial TX/RX interrupt was not occur when TX/RX end.

Regards,
Hamanaka

title: project.py is broken ?
body:
I've encountered the error as follows:

```
$ workspace_tools/project.py
workspace_tools/project.py: line 1: import: command not found
workspace_tools/project.py: line 2: from: command not found
workspace_tools/project.py: line 3: syntax error near unexpected token `('
workspace_tools/project.py: line 3: `ROOT = abspath(join(dirname(__file__), ".."))'
```

The specification of project.py is changed or broken ?

Regards,  
dinau

title: [NUCLEOs] Align hal files
body: Mainly typo corrections. Will ease the factorisation in the future.

title: [RZ_A1H]Fixed a bug of CMSIS-RTOS RTX for Cortex-A9
body:
Hello

I fixed a bug as below.
A bug occured in CMSIS-RTOS RTX for Cortex-A9 when the build option is -O3.

Regards,
Hamanaka

title: [RZ_A1H]Improved program to shrink binary file size
body:
Hello

I improved program to shrink binary file size.
Please check my Pull request.

Regards,
Hamanaka

title: TARGET_STM hal not inheriting similar source
body:
https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/tree/master/libraries/mbed/targets/hal/TARGET_STM

Lots of copy paste here and some specific patches that one target benefits from but not others.

I see that cmsis was re-factored to share common code but is anyone working on doing this for the STM hal?

title: [NUCLEOs] Typo corrections on hal files (astyle)
body: This change will facilitate the diff between the different HAL files before doing a factorisation.

title: RTOS Library compilation error when compiling on developer.mbed.org
add USBTX and USBRX pin definitions for targets that don't provide them
body:
This is so that all of the completely generic tests compile for all targets.

I'm not sure if NC is the correct definition for these – maybe they should be set to whatever the debug IO pins are? – but NC seemed like a safe place to start.

title: add some of the build script dependencies to setup.py
body:
In the process of getting the tests building I needed to install these dependencies, and added them to setup.py.

Now you can do python setup.py install and they'll be installed automagically.

title: Regarding [RZ_A1H] Remove target-specific check from build system (Commit No.142ad22)
body:
Hello

In this commit, our merge request regarding "include path" and your commit content is different .
We need this merge request content in our management of source code.
We want you to reflect again this merge request content to mbed.
Please consider my proposal.

Regards,
Hamanaka

title: Fix Serial::writeable() and txIrq for nRF15822
body: With the old logic if Serial::writeable() was called before and/or used to block calls to Serial::putc() it would never write due to EVENT_TXDRDY trailing a write to TXD. Add a dummy write to TXD before pins are connected to the peripheral. This primes the EVENT_TXDRDY to lead future writes rather than trail. Since STOPTX isn't used this seems safe.

title: / libraries / fs / sd  not in sync
body: There are some contributions here but they dont seem to be getting synced with mbed.org

title: K64F USBDevice Issues
body:
(Using the Freescale FRDM-K64F)
I'm using the USBHID samples from the handbook on mbed.org, and when I connect it to a mac, nothing is detected (I looked in System Information or whatever it's called - the equivalent of device manager), and when I connect it to Windows, it just says the USB Device has malfunctioned.

This error doesn't appear when code not using USB is run, so clearly it's an issue with the USB Device code somewhere. I might try and do some debugging myself at some point, however I thought I'd try and see if anyone else has had similar issues.

title: USB Device Support for STM Nucleo-L152RE Board
Added IAR export support for NUCLEO F103RB
2 UARTs not working with gcc arm embedded
Iar mbed
body: Fixed IAR support for LPC1347 and added it to build_release.

title: New ST cmsis header files
body:
The interface is changed ... grrrrr
The new files have new names. There is a "_hal" inside. If you leave the old files and mark them as deprecated for some time the old code will be compiled, if the headers are included by name - ?  

There is also bug in the timer encoder interface. I have generated the interface code with STM32Cube, but there is one of the config bits missing. The 32 bit timer 5 is not working in encoder mode with this.
I have to compare the registers with the debugger ...

title: [HAL][KSDK] Fixed ACK/NACK received inverted https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/issues/661
body:
As reported by Geremia G
(http://developer.mbed.org/forum/bugs-suggestions/topic/5220/)

The FXO still reported some data back, which makes little sense but is most likely the reason it wasn't found during testing.

title: Updated exporters' capabilities to support CppUTest project exports
body:
## Description

In workflow:

```
build.py -m K64F,LPC1768 -t ARM,GCC_ARM --cpputest -j 4
project.py -m K64F,LPC1768 -i uvision -b -n UT_1
```
- build.py didn't support CppUTest library build support. New --cppcheck switch is introduced to compile and build CppUTest library file with header files. Also CppUTest header files were not copied to build/cpputest directory.
- project.py was unable to pass macros related to CppUTest compilation.
- project.py was unable to properly include CppUTest header files.
## Changes
- Added new switch --cpputest to build.py so now we can build CppUTest library. For details how to use CppUTest library with mbed SDK pelase refer to [Introduction - CppUTest in Mbed SDK testing](http://developer.mbed.org/teams/SDK-Development/wiki/Mbed-SDK-cpputest-usage)
- Added missing exporter support for extra macros needed to build particular library.
  - Aligned exporters for ARM/uARM and GCC_ARM toolchain.
- Added new functionality to -m switch in project.py script. Now user can define more than one platform for exporting, just separate each platform by comma sign (please do not leave any space between platform names)

Below command will export to Keil uVision project UT_1 for K64F and LPC1768 platforms:

```
project.py -m K64F,LPC1768 -i uvision -b -n UT_1
```
- For more information about build scripts please visit our Wiki:
  - [Mbed SDK build script environment](http://developer.mbed.org/teams/SDK-Development/wiki/Mbed-SDK-build-script-introduction)
  - [Mbed SDK automated test suite](http://developer.mbed.org/teams/SDK-Development/wiki/Mbed-SDK-automated-test-suite)
## Validation

Building mbed SDK with CppUTest library for K64F and LPC1768 platforms:

```
[git:cpputest-export*] c:\Work\mbed-przemek\workspace_tools> build.py -m K64F,LPC1768 -t ARM,GCC_ARM --cpputest -j 4
Building library CMSIS (K64F, ARM)
Building library MBED (K64F, ARM)
Building library CPPUTEST (K64F, ARM)
Building library CMSIS (LPC1768, ARM)
Building library MBED (LPC1768, ARM)
Building library CPPUTEST (LPC1768, ARM)
Building library CMSIS (K64F, GCC_ARM)
Building library MBED (K64F, GCC_ARM)
Building library CPPUTEST (K64F, GCC_ARM)
Building library CMSIS (LPC1768, GCC_ARM)
Building library MBED (LPC1768, GCC_ARM)
Building library CPPUTEST (LPC1768, GCC_ARM)
Completed in: (1.85)s

Build successes:
  * ARM::K64F
  * ARM::LPC1768
  * GCC_ARM::K64F
  * GCC_ARM::LPC1768
```

Exporting to Keil uVision project UT_1 for K64F and LPC1768 platforms:

```
[git:cpputest-export*] c:\Work\mbed-przemek\workspace_tools> project.py -m K64F,LPC1768 -i uvision -b -n UT_1
Successful exports:
  * K64F::uvision       C:\Work\mbed-przemek\build\export\UT_1_uvision_K64F.zip
  * LPC1768::uvision    C:\Work\mbed-przemek\build\export\UT_1_uvision_LPC1768.zip
```

Exporting to GCC ARM (Makefile) project UT_1 for K64F and LPC1768 platforms:

```
[git:cpputest-export*] c:\Work\mbed-przemek\workspace_tools> project.py -m K64F,LPC1768 -i gcc_arm -b -n UT_1
Successful exports:
  * K64F::gcc_arm       C:\Work\mbed-przemek\build\export\UT_1_gcc_arm_K64F.zip
  * LPC1768::gcc_arm    C:\Work\mbed-przemek\build\export\UT_1_gcc_arm_LPC1768.zip
```
### Validation results:

Export compilation for GCC ARM, platform K64F:

```
[git:cpputest-export*] c:\Work\mbed-przemek\build\export\UT_1> make
C:/Work/toolchains/gcc_arm_4_8/4_8_2013q4/bin/arm-none-eabi-gcc -mcpu=cortex-m4 -mthumb -Wl,--gc-sections --specs=nano.specs -u _printf_float -u _scanf_float -T./mbed/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/K64FN1M0xxx12.ld -L./mbed/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM -L./cpputest/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM  -o UT_1.elf basic.o env/test_env.o mbed/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/board.o mbed/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/cmsis_nvic.o mbed/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/mbed_overrides.o mbed/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/retarget.o mbed/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/startup_MK64F12.o mbed/TARGET_K64F/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/system_MK64F12.o -lCppUTest -lmbed  -lstdc++ -lsupc++ -lm -lc -lgcc -lnosys -lCppUTest -lmbed  -lstdc++ -lsupc++ -lm -lc -lgcc -lnosys
C:/Work/toolchains/gcc_arm_4_8/4_8_2013q4/bin/arm-none-eabi-objcopy -O binary UT_1.elf UT_1.bin
```

Export compilation for GCC ARM, platform LPC1768:

```
[git:cpputest-export*] c:\Work\mbed-przemek\build\export\UT_1> make
C:/Work/toolchains/gcc_arm_4_8/4_8_2013q4/bin/arm-none-eabi-g++ -mcpu=cortex-m3 -mthumb -c -g -fno-common -fmessage-length=0 -Wall -fno-exceptions -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections -fomit-frame-pointer -fno-rtti -MMD -MP -DNDEBUG -Os -DTARGET_LPC1768 -DTARGET_M3 -DTARGET_CORTEX_M -DTARGET_NXP -DTARGET_LPC176X -DTARGET_MBED_LPC1768 -DTOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM -DTOOLCHAIN_GCC -D__CORTEX_M3 -DARM_MATH_CM3 -DMBED_BUILD_TIMESTAMP=1415724089.81 -D__MBED__=1 -DCPPUTEST_USE_MEM_LEAK_DETECTION=0 -DCPPUTEST_USE_STD_CPP_LIB=0 -DCPPUTEST=1  -std=gnu++98 -I. -I./cpputest -I./cpputest/TARGET_LPC1768 -I./cpputest/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM -I./env -I./mbed -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768 -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TARGET_NXP -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TARGET_NXP/TARGET_LPC176X -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TARGET_NXP/TARGET_LPC176X/TARGET_MBED_LPC1768 -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM  -o basic.o basic.cpp
C:/Work/toolchains/gcc_arm_4_8/4_8_2013q4/bin/arm-none-eabi-g++ -mcpu=cortex-m3 -mthumb -c -g -fno-common -fmessage-length=0 -Wall -fno-exceptions -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections -fomit-frame-pointer -fno-rtti -MMD -MP -DNDEBUG -Os -DTARGET_LPC1768 -DTARGET_M3 -DTARGET_CORTEX_M -DTARGET_NXP -DTARGET_LPC176X -DTARGET_MBED_LPC1768 -DTOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM -DTOOLCHAIN_GCC -D__CORTEX_M3 -DARM_MATH_CM3 -DMBED_BUILD_TIMESTAMP=1415724089.81 -D__MBED__=1 -DCPPUTEST_USE_MEM_LEAK_DETECTION=0 -DCPPUTEST_USE_STD_CPP_LIB=0 -DCPPUTEST=1  -std=gnu++98 -I. -I./cpputest -I./cpputest/TARGET_LPC1768 -I./cpputest/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM -I./env -I./mbed -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768 -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TARGET_NXP -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TARGET_NXP/TARGET_LPC176X -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TARGET_NXP/TARGET_LPC176X/TARGET_MBED_LPC1768 -I./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM  -o env/test_env.o env/test_env.cpp
C:/Work/toolchains/gcc_arm_4_8/4_8_2013q4/bin/arm-none-eabi-gcc -mcpu=cortex-m3 -mthumb -Wl,--gc-sections --specs=nano.specs -u _printf_float -u _scanf_float -T./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/LPC1768.ld -L./cpputest/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM -L./mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM  -o UT_1.elf basic.o env/test_env.o mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/board.o mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/cmsis_nvic.o mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/retarget.o mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/startup_LPC17xx.o mbed/TARGET_LPC1768/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/system_LPC17xx.o -lCppUTest -lmbed  -lstdc++ -lsupc++ -lm -lc -lgcc -lnosys -lCppUTest -lmbed  -lstdc++ -lsupc++ -lm -lc -lgcc -lnosys
C:/Work/toolchains/gcc_arm_4_8/4_8_2013q4/bin/arm-none-eabi-objcopy -O binary UT_1.elf UT_1.bin
```

title: Merge pull request #1 from mbedmicro/master
body: Sync with master

title: Exporting Nucleo L152RE to coIDE or GNU ARM
body: Hi, I am trying to compile the Nucleo L152RE board offline with CoIDE. The Nucleo L152RE doens't have any export function in online compiler for CoIDE or GNU ARM. Does anyone know how to add this, or what compiler/linker options are required to build the Nucleo L152RE board (with STM32L152RE) offline with GNU ARM compiler?

title: Add support for MultiTech mDot module
body: Module is based around an STM32F405RG processor.  Let me know if I'm missing anything.

title: [LPC11U68] Fix GPIO init for specific pins
body:
- Add GPIO initialization value for P0_12, P0_13 and P0_14 since default
  mode for them are other than GPIO
- This issue reported here:
  https://developer.mbed.org/questions/4874/Using-SPI-on-LPCXpresso11U68/

title: [TARGET_DISCO_F303] Reorder structure
body: Moves target disco_f303 into the new structure.

title: [HAL][KSDK] Fix first serial char not being sent
body:
The K64F/K22F didn't send the first char. I don't know why exactly, but
any type of reading a status register seems to fix it. And this extra
line at least makes sense. Now it works correctly.

title: Update RTX_Conf_CM.c
body:
RTOS: RTX - Idle task weak symbol

Changed os_idle_demon() to a weak symbol so that it can be overridden in the main program.

title: Export program does not export to uvision4 for nRF51822 FOTA
body:
In the mbed Client IDE, if you attempt to export a program with the target set to Nordic nRF51822 the Keil uVision option appears. If you change the target to Nordic nRF51822 FOTA (for over the air firmware updates), the export option is grayed out. 

I don't believe there is a good reason for this but looking at uvision4.py it's not obvious to me why that would be (or I would just change it myself and submit a pull request).

title: latest mbed-rtos and mbed.bld broken
body:
Error: Cannot open source input file "cmsis_os.h": No such file or directory in "mbed-rtos/rtos/Mutex.h", Line: 26, Col: 22

Seems like all targets are affected.

http://developer.mbed.org/questions/5186/Cant-find-cmsis_osh-when-compiling-with-/

title: Add repeater pinmode to LPC176X
body: Repeater PinMode was missing for LPC176X
